title: New Perspectives on Education and Culture
abstractText:
This seminar series is coordinated by Professor Jocey Quinn, University of Plymouth and Dr Kim Allen, London Metropolitan University.

It explores how Education and Culture are not separate entities, but inter-related across every aspect of life. What we know and learn in formal and informal spaces is shaped by culture, by the ideas, values and practices that surround us. Similarly those ideas, values and practices are shaped by our experiences of education and learning. A growing interest in education amongst cultural scholars, and the current policy emphasis on education as fluid and lifelong, makes now an ideal moment to explore these inter-connections across academia, policy and practice.

The series is multidisciplinary, bringing together outstanding international scholars such as Lorraine Code, Judith Halberstam and Beverley Skeggs. It focuses on six issues:

  • cultural narratives and forms of knowing
  • popular culture
  • local cultures
  • family cultures
  • teaching cultures
  • knowledge cultures.
